meanings.definition: Shocking or offensive to the moral feelings of the community.
meanings.sent1: The scandalising news spread quickly through the small town.
meanings.sent2: Her scandalising outfit raised eyebrows at the conservative event.
meanings.sent3: The scandalising joke made everyone gasp in disbelief.
meanings.sent4: The scandalising behavior of the celebrity was all over the news.
meanings.sent5: The scandalising image on the front page was hard to ignore.

meanings.definition: To cause scandal or shock by one's actions or behavior.
meanings.sent1: She risked scandalising her family by eloping with her true love.
meanings.sent2: The politician's remarks scandalised the entire nation.
meanings.sent3: The cat scandalised the dogs by stealing their treats.
meanings.sent4: His decision to quit his job scandalised his colleagues.
meanings.sent5: The magician scandalised the audience with his daring tricks.
